text.0: forward upon their way proceed the ready teams the lovely songs.
text.1: further them glorious pūṣan with yoked chariot and the mighty twain.
text.2: with sacred hymns let this man here this singer win the god to whom.
text.3: belong this majesty and might he hath observed our eulogies.
text.4: pūṣan the strong hath knowledge of sweet praises even as indu hath.
text.5: he dews our corn with moisture he bedews the pasture of our kine.
text.6: we will bethink ourselves of thee o pūṣan o thou god as one.
text.7: who brings fulfilment of our hymns and stirs the singer and the sage.
text.8: jointsharer of each sacrifice the driver of the chariot steeds.
text.9: the Ṛṣi who is good to man the singers friend and faithful guard.
text.10: one who is lord of suca lord of suca caring for herself.
text.11: weaving the raiment of the sheep and making raiment beautiful.
text.12: the mighty lord of spoil and wealth strong friend of all prosperity.
text.13: he with light movement shakes his beard lovely and neer to be deceived.
text.14: o pūṣan may those goats of thine turn hitherward thy chariotpole.
text.15: friend of all suppliants art thou born in old time and arm and sure.
text.16: may the majestic pūṣan speed our chariot with his power and might.
text.17: may he increase our store of wealth and listen to this call of ours.
